metadata: (info { (description "Liubo is one of the oldest games known from ancient China. Its distinctive board, with the \"TLV\" pattern, is known since at least the Warring States period in China. Texts and artifacts give clues about the rules of the game, and a recently discovered text purporting to be the rules of the game has not been translated.") (rules "Liubo board. Six pieces per player. Six throwing sticks used as dice.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "134") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/war/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in China, from around 392BCE to 220.") } ) (recon { (concept "NumStartComponents" 12) })
